Text.Value: Yes - but I'll expect you to share what you claim to know about me.
I'm here. A-and so are you. And my father, he - he can't hurt us any longer.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Isobel places a hand on Aylin's shoulder, then her cheek/chin, and raises Aylin's face to meet her gaze. (removes touch while speaking) After Isobel speaks, she helps Aylin rise to her full height.[ChadD] Shoot whole sequence.
EditorData.NodeContext: Chokes up on 'my father, he - '. Still generally disbelieving.

Text.Value: We have met. The instigator of my despair - and then my elation.
I gave my word, and I will keep it. By the fires of your camp's hearth, we will discuss all we must.
Very good. We look forward to it.
If we meet again, it will be my pleasure.
Sorry.

EditorData.NodeContext: Whispered as an aside to the player but in good humour. She's delighted with how Nightsong is acting

Text.Value: Now - you will leave us. We must take succour in one another's bodies and words.
No - if you have something to say to me, say it now.
We'll make our visit brief. Cleric's honour.
But Dame Aylin's life is neverending. And she does not forget. Now - I believe Isobel asked a question of you. We will meet you in your camp - is it agreed?
I am. And I'm glad he's dead. But this is precisely what I want to speak to you about later. It'll keep, I promise.
My love... you were dead. I saw your body...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Isobel approaches her eagerly. [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence.  Aylin takes off her halm and lowers it before casting it aside. Her armor begins to glitter and fade.  Aylin is unsteady on her feet, drops to her knees. Armor and wings fading. Isobel closes the distance as Aylin says her line.
EditorData.NodeContext: to the ground. Aylin falls to her knees, weakened by battle and disbelief

Text.Value: We must watch this one closely, Isobel. Their motivations are suspect - aye, suspect indeed.
Firstly, allow me to apologise to Dame Aylin. My actions were strategy - not personal.
I doubt that. You go your way, and I'll go mine.
I dreamt every night that you'd come back to me. That somehow it was all a nightmare dawn would undo.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. Begins line and partway through Alyin pulls Isobel in, they deeply embrace. Disbelief turning to releif.
EditorData.NodeContext: On 'come back to me,' Aylin breaks the embrace and looks into Isobel's eyes. We want to feign contact here (cinematic constraint) while still maintaining closeness/ implying hand-holding. CC Greg

Text.Value: Ahem. Listen, we need time to figure out what the hells has happened. I thought Aylin dead. She thought the same of me.

EditorData.NodeContext: Interrupting Aylin who is going on a paladin tirade

Text.Value: I'd like to hear why you lied to me about being Ketheric's daughter.
Did I hear you correctly before? Are you Ketheric Thorm's daughter?
His soul was poisoned by the god of death. His sick devotion ruined him.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. Still looking into eachothers eyes.

Text.Value: Do not speak so abruptly to the mate of Dame Aylin, daughter of the Moonmaiden, paladin of -
Begone! I must admire Isobel's fulsome beauty away from prying eyes.
A hundred years hasn't changed you at all, my love. As for you - if we aren't to meet again, I'll say my thank-yous. And my goodbyes.

EditorData.NodeContext: First part to Aylin, Second part to player

Text.Value: It's a little crowded already.
We are not welcome, my love. No matter. We will hie us to the Hill of the Headless Dancer and bare our flesh beneath the cleansing light of the moon's soft gaze.
You'd be most welcome.
Aylin.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Isobel and Nightsong (now Aylin) spot each other from across the room. Both are full of bewilderment, pain, and joy. [ChadD] Shoot entire sequence in mocap stage with two actors Aylin starts with her back to Isobel. Hears her name, briefly hesitates and begins to turn to the familiar voice.

Text.Value: Ho! But we have met. This is the soldier that freed me most valiantly from the Shadowfell.
They watched my boot crush the very brain of villainy - and fought well against your changèd father.
Fine. I'll see you at camp.
Isobel.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot entire sequence in mocap stage with two actors.  Aylin, is exhausted, unsteady on her feet. Sees Isobel, gasps, tension releasing from her body. Isobel is walking slowly towards her.
EditorData.NodeContext: also disbelieving. Aylin is unsteady on her feet. She's been through 100 years of torment, fought Ketheric Thorm, and now she's seeing the love of her life, who she thought dead.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KD] Foly on impact when nightsong falls to her knees. foly of wings also droping Magic sounds when wings fade away
EditorData.VFXTags: [KD] When Nightsong falls to her knees we see her wings fade away in a magic glow

Text.Value: In this moment, I want for nothing.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. After "in this moment," (pause VO) Aylin urgently kisses Isobel. Aylin abruptly lifsts Isobel as she bellows "I want for nothing!"  Both laughing, Isobel still lifted up in Aylins arms, Aylin spins them clockwise. As they spin nightsons wings manifest again before the screen fades to white.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KD] Foly sounds for the wings flapping
EditorData.VFXTags: [KD] Wings appearing with a magic glow after first rotation and glow fades away,

Text.Value: You there, Sharran - by the fires of your camp's hearth, we will discuss all we must.
My forgiveness will be the same. I'd be a fool to turn down a powerful ally - especially one who has earned the trust of fair Isobel.
May he rest in peace at last, now that he's dead.

EditorData.NodeContext: About her father. Tinged with sadness but not too sad. She's about to thank the player warmly.

Text.Value: Hmm - it sounds like we have much to discuss. Perhaps we could join you in your camp later?
Let us join you later. I'm sure we'd have much of interest to say to one another.
This so-called Sharran is known to me. I thought she'd run me through, but she set me free instead.
That's a very good question. I know some parts. Some I haven't quite figured out. But I'd like to tell you everything I know, if you'll have us at your camp later.
I will be. And you?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. Isobel leans back smiling as she asks "Are you?"

Text.Value: Ah! There you are. This is Aylin. Aylin, this is -
I'll be ready. Whatever you have to say had better be worth your life.
You deserve to know that much - and more. It'll keep. I promise.
If Isobel has something to say to me, she can say it now.
We look forward to it.
I had no dreams at all. Nothing but darkness. And when I awoke, my father said you were dead.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. They slightly part, still in eachothers arms, looking into eachothers eyes.
EditorData.NodeContext: mirthless humor - reflecting on the bleak reality

Text.Value: But for all his sins, he brought you back to me. Are you all right?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: [ChadD] Shoot whole sequence. Aylin slightly leans back, searching isobels eyes.  Isobel rasises a trembling hand towards Aylins face. (pause in VO while:) Aylin kisses Isobels fingers before asking "Are you..."
EditorData.NodeContext: She leans back, looking into Isobel's eyes, searching them.

Text.Value: I have more to thank you for than I knew. And we have much to discuss. Perhaps we could join you in your camp later?
Ah! It's you, isn't it? You're the talk of this place, you know. I'm Isobel, and this is -
I hardly know you - what's your role in all this?
Aylin. We'll see you later.

EditorData.NodeContext: Hushing Aylin for saying something embarassing, but good-natured

Synopsis: If Isobel and Nightsong survive Act 2 they will be having a heartfelt reunion during the Epilogue
